docfields.name: Attica::Provider
docfields.text: Use the ProviderManager to instantiate a Provider Accessing functions of the Provider returns a Job class that takes care of accessing the server and parsing the result Provider files are xml of the form opendesktop openDesktop.org The server provides the services specified in the services section not necessarily all of them

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::addNewAchievement
docfields.text: id id of the achievement entry achievement The new Achievement added item post job for adding the new achievement

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::addNewComment
docfields.text: commentType type of the comment CommentType content forum knowledgebase event id id of the content entry where you want to get the comments is from id2 id of the sub content entry where you want to get the comments is from parentId the id of the parent comment if the new comment is a reply subject title of the comment message text of the comment item post job for adding the new comment

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::baseUrl
docfields.text: This should be used as identifier when referring to this provider but you don t want to use the full provider object

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::cancelBuildServiceJob
docfields.text: Setting the ID on the build service parameter is enough for it to work job Buildservicejob to cancel on the server needs at least id set

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::checkLogin
docfields.text: This function does not actually set the credentials Use saveCredentials for that purpose user the user login name password the password the job that will contain the success of the login as metadata

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::createBuildServiceJob
docfields.text: Those three items are mandatory for the job to succeed job Buildservicejob to create on the server

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::createProject
docfields.text: The resulting project ID can be found in the Attica::MetaData of the finished() PostJob You can retrieve it using Attica::MetaData::resultingProjectId() project Project to create on the server

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::createRemoteAccount
docfields.text: Type Type ID login and password are mandatory account RemoteAccount to create on the server

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::deleteAchievement

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::searchContents
docfields.text: Note that categories is not optional If left empty no results will be returned An empty search string search returns the top n items categories categories to search in search optional search string in name/description of the content mode sorting mode page request nth page in the list of results pageSize requested size of pages when calculating the list of results list job for the search results

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::searchContents
docfields.text: More complete version Note that categories is not optional If left empty no results will be returned An empty search string search returns the top n items categories categories to search in person the person-id that created the contents distributions list of distributions to filter by if empty no filtering by distribution is done licenses list of licenses to filter by if empty no filtering by license is done search optional search string in name/description of the content mode sorting mode page request nth page in the list of results pageSize requested size of pages when calculating the list of results list job for the search results

docfields.name: Attica::Provider::searchContentsByPerson
docfields.text: Like searchContents but only contents created by one person person the person-id that created the contents

docfields.name: Attica::ProviderManager
docfields.text: This class is the primary access to Attica s functions Use the ProviderManager to load Open Collaboration Service providers either the default system ones or from XML or custom locations Provider files are defined here provider file example Once you have loaded a Provider use its functions to access the service

docfields.name: Attica::ProviderManager::addProviderFileToDefaultProviders
docfields.text: Provider files contain information about each provider opendesktop openDesktop.org url the url of the provider file

docfields.name: Attica::ProviderManager::contains
docfields.text: whether there s a provider with base url provider

docfields.name: Attica::ProviderManager::defaultProviderFiles
docfields.text: Each of these files can contain multiple providers list of provider file urls

docfields.name: Attica::ProviderManager::providerByUrl
docfields.text: the provider with url base url

docfields.name: Attica::ProviderManager::providerFor
docfields.text: the provider for a given provider url

docfields.name: Attica::ProviderManager::providers
docfields.text: all loaded providers

docfields.name: index
docfields.text: Attica Open Collaboration Service client library Introduction Attica is a Qt library that implements the Open Collaboration Services API version 1.6 The REST API is defined here It grants easy access to the services such as querying information about persons and contents The library is used in KNewStuff3 as content provider In order to integrate with KDE s Plasma Desktop a platform plugin exists in kdebase
